overview_of_class: Statistics 461, Advanced Survey Sampling is a graduate level treatment of essential statistical principles used in sampling human and many other populations. Topics include (1) sample designs such as simple random, stratified, cluster, multi-phase, and network sampling, (2) choosing the appropriate statistical estimators to use in conjunction with a given design, (3) accounting for non-response, and (4) estimating the sampling variances of estimators. Lectures overlap with Stat 325, and a separate weekly session explores material in depth and includes student presentations.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
(i) Calculus at level of Math 234 (multiple integration & vector calculus), and (ii)Two previous courses in probability and statistics, including at least one at the 300 level in either Statistics (other than Stat 330), Econometrics, IE/MS, Math or MMSS.

If you do not meet both prerequisites (i) and (ii) you need permission of instructor. 

Graduate students only.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
